name: Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham Uncasville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Ideal place for Mohegan Sun visitors, who do not want to pay MS hotel prices or when the hotel is full. Has a shuttle that takes you and bring you back to the MS and several restaurants near by. Also nice accomodations, clean and comfortable and complimentary breakfast. Will be back again
reviews.title: Convenient location, great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This Inn has one thing going for it LOCATION. A mile from the casino. It is a convenient alternative. The good is the place is clean and the free shuttles back to casino are an advantage. The check in was fast and the help quite friendly. I also had another bill issue resolved. The room was $134 and then dropped to $79
reviews.title: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!!! THAT'S ALL THEY HAVE HERE.!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: .The negative. They truly mean MICRO. The room although relatively cheap is smaller than a closet. I would only stay in a suite room here. Unless you are just looking for a queen size bed. . The basic room reminded me of a hostel. If you plan on crashing for a few hours this is the place. I would NOT recommend it for romantic getaway. Spend a few more dollars and stay at the Best Western Cristata down the road. Also as stated in other reviews. Check your prices. The change on an hourly basis. On the internet. !!!
reviews.title: prices quoted is not always the actual price you pay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok so me and three of my friends have stayed here before with no poblems. This time I had nothing but poblems. A month before our stay I call for resevations and was qouted 148 for a suite with 4 adults plus we have a AAA card for 10%. A week before the date I call to confim the resevation again and is qouted now 187 and is told no discount can be used on the weekends but after some talking with the person we still can use it. As to why the price went up I was told it was because they had down only 2 people staying not 4. So I asked why would I ask for a suite then which they had down. So when all is said and done the price now qouted is 167 including the discount. At checkin the price is now 187 again. When asked the clerk tells me that the last person I spoke to miss informed me and that the price is 167 but that dosent include taxes an such. So we end up paying 187. 4 days later I go to take money out of my account and it says that my account is overdrawn by 140 dollars which I think cant be true. So into the bank I go and they tell me that there was a charge for 208 dollars and then another fo 187 both from Microtel. I call Microtel and ask what these charges are seeing how I paid 100 cash and should only be chaged 87 on my card and I have the receipt to prove it. They tell me they have no idea and will look into. Mean while it takes a day and a half to get my money back. The whole situatuation was very aggravating which was supposed to be a fun night with the girls. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and would not stay there again if you paid me.
reviews.title: Perfect alterantive to casion hotel minutes away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Nice "dorm like" rooms. Clean comfy and a great cheap alternative for the casino hotels. Stayed for a concert when the Mohegan hotel was $499 a night and spent under $180 here for a suite - reg rooms I think ran around $99 a night. Free shuttle on the weekends to Mohegan until 2am, it cost us $6 to get back and take 3-5 minutes max.
reviews.title: priced just right , comfortable stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked online at the hotel website. When I phoned to verify the reservation a week ahead of our stay, the man who took my call was not very friendly. Property is well maintained inside and out. Plenty of parking. Front desk staff was okay, but not very friendly. Our keys were programmed for a one night stay rather than three. Room was not spacious, but not too compact either. Pleasant decor. Meticulous housekeeping. Only one bath towel (thin, small), but we found maid in hall for extras. Thereafter, extra towels were left daily. Bed was not that comfortable with only two (fairly flat) pillows. No table lamps, only very bright recessed ceiling lights. Pleasant lobby/breakfast room. We didn't try the included continental breakfast.
reviews.title: Mostly Excellent Economy Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is located only 2.5 miles from Mohegan Sun (we had tickets for the Smothers Brothers and Dancing with the Stars). For the rate, we were very pleased with our stay. Mystic is only 1/2 hour away, and there are many other scenic places to visit along the "shore" with many fantastic waterside restaurants.
reviews.title: Not the greatest, wouldn't stay again
Great place, Value for money!
reviews.text: Behind the hotel is a huge Stop & Shop (Starbucks within) and Chili's is right next to the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was small which was expected. TV was mounted on the top of a closet and looked like it was going to fall off. The TV also making a loud humming noise as did all the lights in the room. Bathroom sinks water pressure was way too high and water went everywhere. Also wasn't very clean in the room. Free continental breakfast was cereal, coffee, bagels, english muffins, and tiny muffins...below average hotel you get what you pay for....We should have stayed at the Marriott the next town over.
reviews.title: Beware!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend and I made a trip to watch Wang Leehom in concert at Mohegan Sun Arena late last month and we spent 2 nights at Microtel Inn as the weekend rates at Mohegan hotel were exorbitant. The room rates here are very reasonable and we had a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: A Great Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We’ve just returned from a weekend at Mohegan – wallet a bit lighter but not because we spent too much money on a hotel room at the casino. We’ve stayed at this Microtel several times over the last few years. This hotel allows you to check in at 3pm (which is earlier than most hotels) which gives us time to get ready and have a few drinks with friends and then head to the casino about a mile away. All stays have been consistent – the room is clean, sheets/towels good, and the staff is always professional. We take the shuttle to and from the casino which runs every 10 minutes in the early evening till 2am on weekends. I really like that we can call the shuttle when we are done and it shows up within a few minutes. We’ve never had any noise issues from other guests when we return. This is a no frills hotel; if you want more than a budget friendly, clean and decent place to sleep, then try another place. We’ll keep coming back!
reviews.title: Always a good stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed overnight on New Year's Eve. Had shuttle that took you to Mohegan Sun, about a 10 minute ride. Great driver! Room was small but very clean and quiet. Would definitely stay at again. The price was right!
reviews.title: Good value, close to Mohegan!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The motel was really great for what we wanted and needed - a clean bed with a clean bathroom. Who needs more space when all I wanted was a place to sleep for a few hours and then get showered? The continental breakfast was good, but they could use more tables and chairs. The staff were excellent!
reviews.title: Clean and Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our stay at this hotel was perfectly fine! It is a short drive to Mohegan Sun. In fact, from the parking lot, you can see the casino. We were in a room with two queen beds and there were four of us in the room. Although we did not spend much time in the room, it was a nice space. The beds and pillows were comfortable. In the bathroom, the wall above the top of the shower looked liked it was in the process of being redone and there was a used towel on the back of the door which apparently housekeeping forgot. But overall, we thought the room was great. We took the shuttle to the casino which was no more than 15 minutes. When we arrived at the casino, the driver gave us his card so that we could call him to pick us up. When we were ready to go back to the hotel, we didnt have to wait long after we called him. We paid $155 on a Friday night which we felt was pretty reasonable considering the price we would have paid at Mohegan Sun! We will definitely be staying at this hotel again!
reviews.title: Highly Recommended!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed here on Saturday, August 15th because we couldn't afford to pay $499 to stay at the Mohegan Sun.
reviews.title: Excellent value -- Helpful staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At first we were very happy with this hotel! We were able to check in early which allowed us to get over to the casino eariler than expected! Staff was friendly and our room was clean.......Now heres the bad news....We got back to our room at about 12:30 in the morning, room key not working! Walked down to the desk and the lady was rude but rekeyed the cards........Walked in the romm and low and behold, someone elses stuff was there!!! Yikes thank goodness they were not in the room! So back to the desk and the less than pleasent woman tells us "Oh your room was moved to another room!" Huh what if we left stuff there? Good thing we didnt!
reviews.title: Staying here? Good luck with that!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So off to room number 2! down the hall we go and when we get there....SHOWER RUNNING!!! Knocked on the door and someone says can I help you! Wellit is now about 1:15 in the morning and we just want a room!(3 hour drive or we would have left!)
reviews.title: Better Than Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: So after 20 more minutes of miss happy pounding her keyboard we get a handicapped room! Bed pretty much on the floor and a jungle gym around my toilet bowl...Woohoo!
reviews.title: Great Price, Great Location, Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I may as well have been knocking on doors in the area and asking for a couch to crash on!
reviews.title: Clean, but no cable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So complained in the morning to the office manager and she did give us 50% off but how easy could we have taken anything from 2 different peoples rooms!!!! Not very secure in my book!!!!
reviews.title: Nice for a short Mohegan Sun trip
We call this the bughotel
reviews.text: You know, it was cheap and has tried to improve, but be honest, its in the woods and was crawling, i do mean crawling with bugs. Silverfish, ants and other dead things.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: They said they had sprayed and after that thats when the bugs come out, or should we say fall out.
reviews.title: Honest Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Yes I have been back and may do so again, handicap access is handicap and rather have dead bugs than smoke, and breakfast is a nice touch.
reviews.title: Clean, Great Value, Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: also good because close to but not in casino. if you have a gambler and want to hit RI beaches, its a great compromise.
reviews.title: A good value, near casino, wonderful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But will always be the bughotel to us
reviews.title: Good Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed here last month when we were going to Mohegan Sun for a concert and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for an inexpensive alternative to the casino hotel.
reviews.title: Great rate, easy ride to Mohegan

likes.liked: — price, location, convenience to mohegan sun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: For the rate we paid (~$75) this hotel far exceeded my expectations. We were only at the there for a total of about 18 hours and for this short amount of time I was very happy we stayed at Microtel instead of the far more expensive rooms at Mohegan. The room was clean. Check-in was very fast and they served a decent continental breakfast in the morning. We took the shuttle to Mohegan (5 minute trip or less) and on the way there only had to wait 5 minutes. On the way back we may waited 10 but it was not a big deal at all.
reviews.title: Great Place, great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing strange about the room was a giant tube TV precariously mounted on a downward slant on top of the closet. It looked like it would fall any minute but must have been mounted securely.
reviews.title: Nice place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a Chili's restaurant right across the street from Microtel where we had dinner before the concert.
reviews.title: Average Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a hotel definitely worth investigating. It is not at all fancy but is perfect if you don't plan to spend much time in your room.
reviews.title: Affordable Option for Casino Travelers

likes.liked: — Price and it is close to the casino.
likes.disliked: — No kingsize beds in the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Microtel in Uncasville was very nice. We had a Queen Suite with a refrigerator and microwave. Small couch, and a cute little window seat. Very convenient & right off the highway. Close to Stop and Shop for a quick run for any needed supplies. Room was very clean, bed was comfy, sink was just a bit slow draining (kinda annoying) but otherwise clean (my #1 priority). Very quiet on the 3rd floor. Long walk to the front elevator though. Front desk staff was pleasant except for young gentleman I asked for directions to casino from. He said nothing, wheeled his chair into the back room, wheeled himself back out and handed me a sheet of paper with the directions pre-printed on it. I'm sure a million and one people ask him for directions every day, but he could have at least said "Sure!" or something halfway pleasant.... Continental breakfast was ok. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: Pretty nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I knew very little about this hotel and since we got the cheapest single room ($72.00 @ night), I expected the worst. But I was wrong! The room itself is really VERY small, hardly any room to move around, but I realize that it was nothing that anyone had any control over.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than that, the room was CLEAN, presentable, and attractive, and the same went for the rest of the hotel. The staff was professional yet congenial, and Mike (who drove the hotel shuttle bus to Mohegan Sun) was willing to go out of his way to make himself available to us (keep in mind that the shuttle bus only operates in the evening, though).
reviews.title: What a Value!

likes.liked: — price, size of room, proximity to casino.
likes.disliked: — Rude staff member, No casino shuttle during afternoon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed the two nights, but for a short stay even this small room fits our needs perfectly. Not to mention that this hotel is only one mile away from Mohegan Sun (a five minute drive).
reviews.title: Agree with previous review, good cheap alternative

likes.disliked: — Sink missing plug, alarm clock set by previous occupant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: So knowing what I know now, this is a good alternative to more pricey hotels in the area. And I would definitely stay there again. I hope that they do keep up the good work because they have a good thing going here and I wish this hotel chain much good luck in the future.
reviews.title: Good, cheap, overnight alternative to Mohegan

likes.disliked: — regular room was a little small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I agree with almost everything written by the previous reviewer (srahula). We also were attending a Mohegan Sun Arena concert, and needed an inexpensive place to stay before driving 45 miles home the next morning.
reviews.title: This Place is Very Good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: We also had a small single room with 1 queen bed, but the room was clean and we paid $76 plus taxes and fees. We had an adjoining room but luckily, it may have been unoccupied. (We did request a quiet non-smoking location when making our reservation on their website.) We opted to drive ourselves 2 miles down the road and park in the casino garage rather than use the shuttle. (Remember to note which garage, floor and section you park in, we saw concert-goers who could not find their car. Also, allow lots of extra time (30 minutes) for getting out of some parts of the garage after the concert).
reviews.title: Perfect inexpensive way to stay near Mohegan

description: Welcome to the Microtel Inn and Suites, an Uncasville hotel near the Mohegan Sun Casino. Conveniently located off Route 2, the Microtel Inn and Suites hotel is only one mile from Mohegan Sun Casino with free transportation to the casino Sunday to Thursday 5 p.m. to 1 a.m. and Friday and Saturday 4 p.m. to 2 a.m. This Uncasville, CT, hotel is minutes from: Dodd Stadium, Mystic Seaport and Mystic Village. Experience a wine-and-cheese boat ride or just shopping this quaint village. Mystic Aquarium and Institute for Exploration, a recognized leader in oceanic research featuring living marine creatures and the latest discoveries of the underwater world. Eastern Connecticut State University, Connecticut College, Foxwoods Casino, Norwich Golf Course, Clinton Crossing Premium Outlets shopping center, Long Island Sound and Stonington Vineyards are less than 30 miles away. Local businesses near the hotel include Computer Sciences Corporation, The William W. Backus Hospital and FreePort McMoran. Hotel Services and Amenities: Scheduled shuttle service to Mohegan Sun Casino. Conference room with high-speed Internet access; audio-visual equipment available. Free local and long-distance calls within the Continental U.S. Free continental breakfast. Seven ADA-compliant guestrooms, TTY Telephone, auxiliary aids available, wheelchair accessible. Connecting rooms available. All rooms have coffee maker, hair dryer, high-speed wireless internet, iron and ironing board, cable TV with ESPN, CNN and HBO. Microwave, refrigerator and sleeper sofa available in suites only. Dry cleaning and laundry services available. Crib and rollaway bed available. Free outside recreational vehicle and truck parking. This property does not permit pets.
